'A void that can never be filled': France marks 10th anniversary of November 13 attacks
subhead: From the Stade de France to the Bataclan, ordinary citizens and officials paid tribute on Thursday to the 132 people whose lives were taken by the 2015 attacks. On Place de la République, a ceremony brought Parisians together late into the night.

title: Cash-strapped France hunts down €10 billion in missing VAT

Uyghurs are no longer welcome in Turkey
subhead: As Turkey strengthens ties with China, the Turkish government has shifted its migration policy toward members of the Muslim minority from Xinjiang, a community it historically protected. Expulsions of Uyghurs are on the rise, as revealed by a Human Rights Watch investigation.

title: Soraya Martinez Ferrada, from Chilean refugee to Montreal mayor
subhead: Promising change, Soraya Martinez Ferrada, a former minister under Justin Trudeau, made history on Thursday by becoming the first woman of immigrant background to lead Québec's largest city.

title: The relentless spiral of speed watching: 'If I don't set it to at least 1.5×, I get bored'
subhead: From TikTok to YouTube, more and more young people are watching videos at increased speeds to consume more content in less time.

title: Leaders of international Gen Z movement reflect on their countries' political futures
subhead: From Nepal to Madagascar and Peru, youth-led revolts driven by socio-economic demands have shaken governments. But their horizontal mobilization strategy, born of digital culture, now hampers the political outcomes of these movements.

subhead: Is Europe ready for war? Apart from Finland, the answer is no, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: How the Paris attacks of November 13, 2015, unfolded, minute-by-minute
subhead: Le Monde has gathered exclusive first-hand testimonies and created a 3D Bataclan reconstruction to revisit the night that changed France, 10 years ago.

title: The new life of a former Bataclan hostage
subhead: In December 2015, Marie Hourcastagnou declined to speak to Le Monde when we profiled her husband Arnaud, the last hostage to be freed by the police. Ten years later, she agreed to share her story.
